question: Question_Section_201_06_(d)
statement:
Consider the same graph as in the
\href{Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH307/April_2013/Question_Section_201_05_(a)}{previous
question}, now interpreted as an internet where the vertices represent
web pages and the arrows represent links.

\begin{description}
\itemsep1pt\parskip0pt\parsep0pt
\item[]
\includegraphics[width=.5\textwidth]{MATH307April2013Section201Q6.png}
\end{description}

\textbf{(d)} Write down the MATLAB/Octave code that would compute the
ranking for each page using the \textbf{eig} command.
sols:
\textgreater{}\textgreater{} {[}V D{]} = eig(S)

Where \emph{V} is the matrix of normalized eigenvectors, and \emph{D} is
the diagonal matrix of eigenvalues.

It can be assumed that $\displaystyle \lambda _1 = 1$ is the first entry
in \emph{D}, the corresponding eigenvector is the first column of matrix
\emph{V}. To get the ranking we scale so that the sum is equal to 1.

\textgreater{}\textgreater{} V(:,1) / sum(V(:,1))
